JUDGES: George Nicolaou;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr M. Finucane , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was convicted in DATE of fraudulently using a licence . He received a fine .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant was arrested and detained at FAC on suspicion of harassment contrary to section CARDINAL of LAW DATE following an incident involving his former wife . Photographs , fingerprints and a DNA sample were taken . The applicant received a caution in respect of the incident and was released on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant complained to ORG about the arrest . His complaint was investigated and on DATE Detective Inspector PERSON confirmed that the arrest was lawful .
CARDINAL . NORP In or around September CARDINAL the applicant ’s solicitors wrote back to Detective Inspector PERSON questioning the legality of the caution and requesting that it be rescinded .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was advised that the caution would be removed from his record .

CARDINAL . On or around DATE the applicant ’s solicitors requested that the police use their discretion to delete the applicant ’s DNA , fingerprints and photographs . On DATE , he was advised that his request to have the DNA data destroyed had been refused .

CARDINAL . On DATE a further request was received by the police from the applicant for deletion of his DNA , fingerprints and photographs . The request was treated as having been made under the procedure allowing deletion of such data in exceptional circumstances . Receipt of the request was acknowledged on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following an examination of the facts and circumstances relating to the applicant ’s arrest , the police decided to delete the applicant ’s DNA , fingerprints and photographs .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was informed that his case was considered to be exceptional and that his DNA sample and other records would be destroyed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the record of the applicant ’s DNA profile was deleted .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the applicant ’s DNA sample and profile were deleted .
CARDINAL . On DATE the electronic record of the applicant ’s fingerprints was deleted .
CARDINAL . On DATE the offence recorded in ORG in respect of the applicant was deleted .
CARDINAL . On DATE the hard copy record of the applicant ’s fingerprints and his ORG record were deleted .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was advised that all his records and samples had been deleted .
CARDINAL . For details of the relevant domestic law see PERSON and GPE v. GPE [ ORG ] , ORG . CARDINAL and DATE .
